name: name
desc: Sexagesimal, equatorial position-based source name in the form: JHHMMSS.ss+DDMMSS.s. The full naming convention for IPHAS DR2 sources has the form "IPHAS2 JHHMMSS.ss+DDMMSS.s", where "J" indicates the position is J2000. The "IPHAS2" prefix is not included in the column.

name: ra
desc: J2000 Right Ascension with respect to the 2MASS PSC reference frame (which is consistent with ICRS to within 0.1 arcsec). The coordinate given is obtained from the astrometric measurement in the r'-band exposure. If the source is undetected in r', then the i' or Hα-band coordinate is given.

name: dec
desc: J2000 Declination. See comments above.

name: sourceID
desc: Unique identification number of the detection. Identical to rDetectionID if the source was detected in the r-band; identical to iDetectionID or haDetectionID otherwise.

name: posErr
desc: Astrometric fit error (RMS). Be aware that the error might be significantly larger than the RMS near CCD edges.

name: l
desc: Galactic longitude $\ell$ converted from ra/dec (IAU 1958 system).

name: b
desc: Galactic latitude $b$ converted from ra/dec (IAU 1958 system).

name: mergedClass
desc: Image classification flag based on all bands (1=galaxy, 0=noise, -1=star, -2=probableStar, -3=probableGalaxy, -9=saturated). Computed using the UKIDSS scheme.

name: mergedClassStat
desc: Merged N(0,1) stellarness-of-profile statistic. Computed using the UKIDSS scheme.

name: pStar
desc: Probability that the source is a star (value between 0 and 1).

name: pGalaxy
desc: Probability that the source is a galaxy (value between 0 and 1).

name: pNoise
desc: Probability that the source is noise (value between 0 and 1).

name: pSaturated
desc: Probability that the source is saturated (value between 0 and 1).

name: rmi
desc: ($r$ - $i$) colour, formed by subtracting columns r and i. Included in the catalogue for convenience only. To obtain the uncertainty, take the root of the sum of the squares of columns rErr and iErr.

name: rmha
desc: ($r$ - Hα) colour, formed by subtracting columns r and ha. See comments above.

name: r
desc: Default r-band magnitude using a 2.3 arcsec diameter aperture. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: rErr
desc: Uncertainty for r. Does not include systematic errors.

name: rPeakMag
desc: Alternative r-band magnitude derived from the peak pixel height (i.e. a 0.3x0.3 arcsec square aperture). Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: rPeakMagErr
desc: Uncertainty in rPeakMag. Does not include systematics.

name: rAperMag1
desc: Alternative r-band magnitude using a 1.2 arcsec diameter aperture. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: rAperMag1err
desc: Uncertainty in rAperMag1. Does not include systematics.

name: rAperMag3
desc: Alternative r-band magnitude using a 3.3 arcsec diameter aperture. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: rAperMag3err
desc: Uncertainty in rAperMag3. Does not include systematics.

name: rGauSig
desc: RMS of axes of ellipse fit in r.

name: rEll
desc: Ellipticity in the r-band.

name: rPA
desc: Position angle in the r-band.

name: rClass
desc: Discrete image classification flag (1=galaxy, 0=noise, -1=star, -2=probableStar, -3=probableGalaxy, -9=saturated).

name: rClassStat
desc: N(0,1) stellarness-of-profile statistic.

name: rErrBits
desc: Bitmask used to flag a bright neighbour (1), source blending (2) and saturation (8).

name: rMJD
desc: Modified Julian Date at the start of the r-band exposure.

name: rSeeing
desc: Average Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of stars in the same CCD frame.

name: rDetectionID
desc: Unique identifier of the r-band detection in the format "#run-#ccd-#number", i.e. composed of the INT telescope run number, the CCD number and a sequential source detection number.

name: rX
desc: Pixel coordinate of the source in the r-band exposure, in the coordinate system of the CCD.

name: rY
desc: Pixel coordinate of the source in the r-band exposure, in the coordinate system of the CCD.

name: i
desc: Default i-band magnitude using a 2.3 arcsec diameter aperture. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: iErr
desc: Uncertainty for i. Does not include systematic errors.

name: iPeakMag
desc: Alternative i-band magnitude derived from the peak pixel height (i.e. a 0.3x0.3 arcsec square aperture). Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: iPeakMagErr
desc: Uncertainty in iPeakMag. Does not include systematics.

name: iAperMag1
desc: Alternative i-band magnitude using a 1.2 arcsec diameter aperture. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: iAperMag1err
desc: Uncertainty in iAperMag1. Does not include systematics.

name: iAperMag3
desc: Alternative i-band magnitude using a 3.3 arcsec diameter aperture. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: iAperMag3err
desc: Uncertainty in iAperMag3. Does not include systematics.

name: iGauSig
desc: RMS of axes of ellipse fit.

name: iEll
desc: Ellipticity.

name: iPA
desc: Position angle.

name: iClass
desc: Discrete image classification flag (1=galaxy, 0=noise, -1=star, -2=probableStar, -3=probableGalaxy, -9=saturated).

name: iClassStat
desc: N(0,1) stellarness-of-profile statistic.

name: iErrBits
desc: Bitmask used to flag a bright neighbour (1), source blending (2) and saturation (8).

name: iMJD
desc: Modified Julian Date at the start of the single-band exposure.

name: iSeeing
desc: Average Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of stars in the same CCD frame.

name: iDetectionID
desc: Unique identifier of the r-band detection in the format "#run-#ccd-#number", i.e. composed of the INT telescope run number, the CCD number and a sequential source detection number.

name: iX
desc: Pixel coordinate of the source, in the coordinate system of the CCD.

name: iY
desc: Pixel coordinate of the source, in the coordinate system of the CCD.

name: iXi
desc: Position offset of the i-band detection relative to the ra column. The original i-band coordinates can be obtained by computing (ra+iXi/3600, dec+iEta/3600).

name: iEta
desc: Position offset of the i-band detection relative to the dec column. See comments above.

name: ha
desc: Default H-alpha magnitude using a 2.3 arcsec aperture. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: haErr
desc: Uncertainty for ha. Does not include systematic errors.

name: haPeakMag
desc: Alternative H-alpha magnitude derived from the peak pixel height (i.e. a 0.3x0.3 arcsec square aperture). Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: haPeakMagErr
desc: Uncertainty in haPeakMag. Does not include systematics.

name: haAperMag1
desc: Alternative H-alpha magnitude using a 1.2 arcsec diameter aperture. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: haAperMag1err
desc: Uncertainty in haAperMag1. Does not include systematics.

name: haAperMag3
desc: Alternative H-alpha magnitude using a 3.3 arcsec diameter aperture. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: haAperMag3err
desc: Uncertainty in haAperMag3. Does not include systematics.

name: haGauSig
desc: RMS of axes of ellipse fit.

name: haEll
desc: Ellipticity

name: haPA
desc: Position angle.

name: haClass
desc: Discrete image classification flag (1=galaxy, 0=noise, -1=star, -2=probableStar, -3=probableGalaxy, -9=saturated).

name: haClassStat
desc: N(0,1) stellarness-of-profile statistic.

name: haErrBits
desc: Bitmask used to flag a bright neighbour (1), source blending (2) and saturation (8).

name: haMJD
desc: Modified Julian Date at the start of the single-band exposure.

name: haSeeing
desc: Average Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of stars in the same CCD frame.

name: haDetectionID
desc: Unique identifier of the r-band detection in the format "#run-#ccd-#number", i.e. composed of the INT telescope run number, the CCD number and a sequential source detection number.

name: haX
desc: Pixel coordinate of the source, in the coordinate system of the CCD.

name: haY
desc: Pixel coordinate of the source, in the coordinate system of the CCD.

name: haXi
desc: Position offset of the H-alpha detection relative to the ra column. The original Ha-band coordinates can be obtained by computing (ra+haXi/3600, dec+haEta/3600).

name: haEta
desc: Position offset of the H-alpha relative to the ra column. See comments above.

name: brightNeighb
desc: True if a very bright star is nearby (i.e. errBits ≥ 1). This indicates that the source might be spurious, or the photometry unreliable.

name: deblend
desc: True if the source was blended with a nearby neighbour due to crowding (i.e. errBits ≥ 2). Although a deblending procedure is applied when measuring the photometry, the result may be unreliable (e.g. colours should not be trusted).

name: saturated
desc: True if the source is saturated (i.e. peak pixel > 55000 counts) in one or more bands (i.e. errBits ≥ 8). The photometry of saturated stars is affected by systematic errors.

name: errBits
desc: Maximum value of (rErrBits, iErrBits, haErrBits).

name: nBands
desc: Number of bands in which the source is detected (equals 1, 2 or 3).

name: reliable
desc: True if: errBits ≤ 2 & nBands == 3 & r > 13 & i > 12 & ha > 12.5 & rErr < 0.1 & iErr < 0.1 & haErr < 0.1 & (abs(r-rAperMag1) < 3*hypot(rErr,rAperMag1Err)+0.03) & (abs(i-iAperMag1) < 3*hypot(iErr,iAperMag1Err)+0.03) & (abs(ha-haAperMag1) < 3*hypot(haErr,haAperMag1Err)+0.03).

name: veryReliable
desc: True if: reliable & pStar > 0.9 & errBits = 0.

name: fieldID
desc: Human-readable IPHAS field number and observing run (e.g. 0001o_aug2003).

name: fieldGrade
desc: Internal quality control score of the field. One of A, B, C or D.

name: night
desc: Night of the observation (YYYYMMDD). Refers to the UT date at the start of the night.

name: seeing
desc: Maximum value of (rSeeing, iSeeing, haSeeing).

name: ccd
desc: CCD-chip number on the Wide Field Camera (WFC) of the Isaac Newton Telescope (INT). 1, 2, 3 or 4.

name: nObs
desc: Number of repeat observations of this source in the survey.

name: sourceID2
desc: SourceID of the object in the partner exposure (if obtained within 10 minutes of the primary detection).

name: fieldID2
desc: FieldID of the partner detection (e.g. 0001o_aug2003).

name: r2
desc: r-band magnitude in the dithered partner field, i.e. the dithered repeat measurement obtained within 10 minutes (if available).

name: rErr2
desc: Uncertainty for r2.

name: i2
desc: i-band magnitude in the dithered partner field, i.e. the dithered repeat measurement obtained within 10 minutes (if available).

name: iErr2
desc: Uncertainty for i2.

name: ha2
desc: H-alpha magnitude in the dithered partner field, i.e. the dithered repeat measurement obtained within 10 minutes (if available).

name: haErr2
desc: Uncertainty for ha2.

name: errBits2
desc: Error bitmask for the partner detection. Used to flag a bright neighbour (1), source blending (2), saturation (8), vignetting (64), truncation (128) and bad pixels (32768).
